page.title: 19BOLTON WANDERERS F.C.
page.content: Bolton Wanderers Football Club known as the 'Trotters' is situated at Burnden park on Manchester Road. They entered the football league in 1888 in Division 1. They play in white shirts and navy shorts. Bolton have won the F.A. Cup 5 times. 1958 was their most successful season because they won the F. A. Cup and the Charity Shield and finished 4th in Division 1. In 1946 disaster struck. Bolton were playing Stoke City and the barrirers collapsed, killing 33 people. Nat Lofthouse, with 33 England caps to his credit, an ex-player,ex-manager and now manager of the Executive Club said that the crowds are very low (an average of 5,000 per match) because of increasing crowd violence and because the club hasn't much money to buy good players.
